results.title: Growing up in a scary world (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeanne H. Block, Thelma Harms and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Filmed in a nursery school group of 4 and 5 year olds in the spring of 1970 during a time of crisis in the adult world. The staff provided a small sandbox with a number of small toys in order to see how young children use spontaneous play in a time of stress. The results lend themselves to discussion on many issues.

results.title: Growing up female
results.brief_description: This film gives graphic illustration of the kind of conditioning that women undergo in society, in an attempt to examine and question the whole framework of the women’s role. Women from various age-groups are presented, all of them revealing in some degree their mental conditioning. Advertising media are viewed as instrumental in this process. The film raises important questions as to the depth of the problem and the possibilities of liberating women in the present social order.

results.title: Growing up at St Giles
results.creator_credit: Andrew Steane and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The care and treatment of physically handicapped children at St. Giles home, Launceston. Boarders and day pupils attend the Home, receiving physiotherapy, schooling and the individual attention and group activities they need to overcome difficulties and stand on their own feet. The types of disabilities treated and examples of how former pupils have settled into ordinary employment.

results.title: Community College Mt Gambier: growing
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, New Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the story of the South East Community College Mount Gambier. Features two teachers, Bev Puckridge and Ian Winter, who narrate throughout the film. Shows how students go back to their own communities and set up and teach smaller groups in woodwork, pottery, spinning etc. Emphasis is made that art is a natural part of our world - a natural thing to do. It is not the finished product that really matters, but the thought process used to achieve it.

results.title: Mathematics - a foundation course: groups 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Clamp, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Mathematical meaning of the term “group”, basic requirements, by inter-changing spheres in two different arrangements we can arrive at the same group, (klein 4), symmetry throughout history, predicting vibrations of water molecules.

results.title: Group discussions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Illustrates differences between social conversation and purposeful group discussion by showing how typical American family proceeds through various stages of a discussion on whether or not son should go to college. Family members shown in other group discussion situations in school, PTA, business conferences, and at symposium. Lists five factors in group discussion. Leadership and individual participation is stressed.

results.title: Group Activities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A group of children is presented with some common household materials with which to create things, as the basis for an art lesson. The teacher’s intent is to stimulate individual thought and effort without attempting to pre-determine their efforts.

results.title: Groundwork for progress
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Today Britain is bringing her century-old railway system up to date. The modernisation plan includes relaying lines, strengthening bridges, and viaducts, and building new stations, good sheds, sidings, and marshalling yards. Shows the engineering problems are tackled and the work carried out without dislocation traffic on the most heavily used railway system in the world.
